content:
Welcome to Delicious Mafia!
"A flavor full of flavor!"



It seemed like a regular night at Aero's Italian Bistro. Thirteen guests of different backgrounds all arrive at relatively the same time, all around 6PM to watch the sports game. All is well, but one of the chefs come running out of the kitchen. One of the new frycooks had been murdered! Apon further examination, it was discovered that he'd been poisoned, not long ago. Since all of the other chefs and employees at Aero's Bistro had to have their hands washed at ALL TIMES, it couldn't have been them, so the only logical option is that a small group within the guests had conspired against the bistro, and plotted to close it's doors forever!

Finally, Aero comes up with the most logical solution; the guests will be locked in the restaurant and forced to decide among themselves who the killers are. Meanwhile, the bistro would provide them with all the delicious food they could eat!

rulesGeneral Rules

1) All sitewide rules apply. Read them here
2) This is my color. No using it under any circumstances, and no impersonating or pretending to impersonate the mod.
3) Play to your faction's win condition, as long as you do not break any game or site rules in doing so.
4) You may not discuss this game anywhere outside the game thread unless explicitly permitted to do so in your role PM.
5) Directly quoting your role PM, QT or private communications with the mod is strictly forbidden. Loose paraphrasing is permitted.
6) I expect every player to be civil and to treat eachother with respect. Mafia is a heated game, but I'll interfere if anyone resorts to excessive insults, personal attacks, or bullying.
7) No weird forms of encryption. Crumbing is perfectly OK.

Voting/Lynching Mechanics

I) For your vote or unvote to be counted, it must either be in the form of Vote: Aeronaut or VOTE: Aeronaut. Nicknames/abbreviations are fine as long as I know who you're talking about.
II) A lynch will occur when 50%+1 of the votes are cast for the same player. (E.G. if there are 9 people left in-game, 5 votes insures a lynch)
III) You may vote for "no lynch" if you wish. If 50% of the players in the game vote for no-lynch, the game will progress to night without a lynch.
IV) If you are killed, you may make one tasteful "Bah" post, but it must 100% non revealing of any sort of game information, or anything of that sort. It must be a farewell only.
V) Twilight phase talking is allowed.

Activity and Deadlines

I) Each Day phase will last [number of living players + 4] days. For example, if there are 10 players left in the game, you will have a two week deadline.
II) Deadlines will be extended for replacement situations and exceptional circumstances.
III) Night phases will last for 72 hours.
IV) In order to be accepted, night actions must be PMd to the mod or posted in bold in scum QTs before the deadline is up. If a player does not select one, he or she will default to "no action."
V) Players will be prodded after forty-eight hours without posting. All prods will be announced in thread.
VI) Players who do not respond to a prod within twenty-four hours or need to be prodded three times in a game phase will be force-replaced.
VII) If you will be unable to post for over forty-eight hours, inform the mod by PM or in the thread of when you'll be V/LA. Assuming the V/LA period is of reasonable length, you will be exempt from prods during that time. All V/LA notifications will be made public by the mod.
VIII)Please keep the game active! If you're in like ten other games and are planning on lurking through this, just replace out.

Other

I) I reserve the right to add, remove, or modify rules at any point of the game if it becomes necessary.
II) Pretending to break the rules is just as bad as breaking them, and will be taken just as seriously.
II) If you feel like I've missed something, or you feel I need to take action about something, please let me know in-thread or by PM.



Sample Vanilla Townie PMWelcome to Delicious Mafia!

You are a Vanilla Townie. You have no special abilities. You may vote during the day.

You win when all threats to the Town have been eliminated.

The game thread is here.

I've been trying to rid myself of the "overwordiness" thing I had in my first game. This…is not the post for that to happen.

TSO ISO (yes, I did put those two initialisms next to each other on purpose):

Spoiler:
Started out the game by briefly commenting on choof's somewhat…difficult play.

First post of any significance was a scumread on KOP in 403. At first I thought that he hadn't moved his vote onto KOP, but turns out his RVS vote was already there.

He claimed a post later that KOP's 308 was "opportunistic". I don't like scumcases built on a single post, especially with the certainty that TSO did here, but it seems like town does this all the time, so whatever. What does bug me is that a lot of his posts afterwards are claims that everybody should sheep him…basically off of the single KOP post.

The KOP push wasn't horrible in and of itself. The fact that it was built on a single vote wasn't bad. TSO treating KOP like confirmed scum for making a vote he didn't like…that was bad.

Anyway, we all know the drill by now, SilverWolf softs, TSO moves his vote off of KOP, then much later Ozgin pressures SilverWolf into fullclaiming as mason with KOP.

Starting around 521 TSO gets involved in SW vs. Riblet, siding with SilverWolf. In other circumstances I might have called this buddying, but considering Riblet's play…yeah I think I'm fine with it.

In 886, TSO finally votes for the first time since unvoting KOP, putting his vote on Boonskiies, due to Boons lurking. Unvotes in 939 after Boon returns to the thread.

In 1091 TSO responds to Riblet and Saul attacking him for his KOP push. While I didn't especially love the KOP push (and it's weird seeing Saul (choof) and Riblet working together if only for a second here), his responses, especially to the second part are solid, in particular pointing out Saul's bad logic.

I like 1112 for town. Or to be more specific, the last part of 1112. It's another example of TSO recognizing bad logic and pointing it out.

1341 is TSO's vote on Wrong Song. It's explained through a specific example of a contradiction in Wrong Song's catchup post. The following post notes that Wrong Song's catchup post was "blantantly full of contradictions". This is a solidly explained vote, much better, even without the ensuing context, than the KOP vote IMO.

In 1347 TSO, at prompting from House, explains why he thinks Wrong Song is worse than TN. According to TSO, tn could just be lazy. Wrong Song looks blatantly scummy, due to the contradictions in Song's readslist. I haven't made up my mind yet on Wrong Song (that's coming next), but this, at the very least, remains a good looking read by TSO.

In 1486, TSO dismisses any posts by Boon as "hardcore trolling", basically telling us to ignore them all. Okay, this I really don't like (though I did find it amusing when Boon took that as a compliment, considering we just had a player replace out due to being called a troll to often)


Conclusion: I don't like TSO's initial read on KOP, not just because KOP turned out a mason, but also because it was fairly insubstantial. He's also been slow to use his vote this game, which for a player apparently known for being aggressive I find odd. His later read on Wrong Song feels better though, and he's been pretty solid at pointing out logical fallacies through the more recent portions of the game. Most of the stuff I don't like from his game I've seen coming from town. So that's a townread on TSO for me.

The reason I ask is because this is something Antihero said in a game once and I made a note of it in case I ever run into it:

Scum don't claim vengeful. They don't claim supersaint.

How you deal with the claim: you leave them around until lylo then policy lynch them if they're still there. That's what defeats a scum fakeclaim of vengeful.

When scum claim things, they claim things that will DETER their lynch, like investigatives or protectives (or a sorrowful VT claim that tugs at the heartstrings). They want to make town feel like they're taking a gamble in lynching them. A vengeful or supersaint claim won't create the same effect.

I believe he said keep them around until lylo because vengeful can't kill in lylo. So this is the best way to deal with House's claim I think.

Of course, I'm open to suggestions that say otherwise.

The problem with Antihero's approach is that you are effectively giving potential scum a free pass to end game, reducing the chances of nailing scum by removing one known bad slot from the poe, and give the scum a better chance at winning the game kingmaker.  I don't think Towns generally have the nut to follow through on a PL at LYLO.  While I appreciate the theory, I just haven't seen it done in practice.

Boonskiies has been Lynched!

On their third day locked in the bistro, the remaining 9 guests begin to grow weary. Their suit jackets tattered, their pants stained with grease, being locked in this place was becoming tiresome. It was only halfway through the day when the suggestion was made.

"Let's kill Boon."

Suddenly, stirs of unease break out; Kill Boon? That guy that had just been sitting there smiling for the last 72 hours? No, they couldn't do that, could they? The afternoon sun shone through the windows, and it began to fade. The more the guests looked at it, the less option they had; besides, this guy was too happy. He needed to be taken down a peg.

Eight guests gather around Boon and pick him up; they carry him down the stairs of the area that says STAFF ONLY. Boon just kept on smiling. Gosh was this guy weird. They approached a giant vat of a thick brown boiling substance.

"Chocolate..." whispered Silverwolf. They hoisted Boon up on a little ramp, and let go. He slid into the boiling chocolate, still without much fight in him. As he sank deeper and deeper into the chocolate, only above his torso was visible, then his shoulders, then his head. The last of Boon melted away with one last silly smile, and finally he was dead.

As the 7 remaining dinner guests continue to bicker over whose who, the sound of car horns and the pitter patter of rain can be heard outside. It is Monday morning. They'd spent four days in this place, trying to figure out who the killers were. Their nice suits and dresses were now worn out and wrinkled, stained with delicious, albeit growing tiresome food selections.

Finally, House takes a stand. "It's got to be Lucky, he says. "There's no other option". Saul Goode nods his head in aggreement. A few others seem to agree as well.

"NO!" yelled Lucky. "It's not me! You've got it wrong!" He backs away. "No, I think we're quite right" says T S O.

Lucky tries to run, but T S O jumps in front of him and pulls his gun. "SEE YA LATER, SHIT LORD!" He yells, as he pulls the trigger. Lucky2u falls to the ground, spouting dark colored blood. "I'm... Innocent." he says. He gasps for another moment, and is dead.

Aero pops out of his kitchen with an apron that says 'Kiss the Cook'. "Did another one die? OMG you guys I haven't even finished breakfast yet." Then he stops. "Wait a moment...." said Aero. "Where did you get that gun?"

T S O turns to Aero. "....Whoops!" he yells. He shoots Aero square in the leg, and Aero falls to the ground. He looks up. "... I knew it all along." said Aero. "You're from Tony Spagoni's Pizza Joint! You want me put out of business! He paid you to come murder my cook so that we'd fail our health inspection!"

"Oh no... not at all." said T S O. He peeled off his mask, revealing a familiar, but menacing face. "I AM Tony Spagoni!" A look of horror falls across Aero's face. T S O shoots him in the head, just as a fuse blows and the lights turn out.

T S O's laughter can be heard throughout the halls of the resturaunt as the dinnerguests run for their lives. "And I wasn't alone!" He screams.

Goodmorning runs to the front door in the main lobby. Still locked. A bolt of lightnight strikes outside and House can be seen standing at the window nonchalently. "That's cute" he says. He takes out his knife. "See you in hell!" he yells, plunging it into Goodmorning. Goodmorning is dead.

Zebulin had run into the back room of the building, trying to find an alterior exit. He opens a door which he believes to be the back door, and runs through it it.

Suddenly, he begins to shiver. He backs into a pile of frozen meat and realizes he has run into the freezer. He runs back to the door and jiggles the handle; someone had locked it from the outside. He sees TSO's face smiling as he slowly begins freezing to death.

Finslly, Bookitty and Saul Goode are running through the kitchen in the dark, trying to find some way out. The deep voice of House can be heard from not far away: "Stop trying to run, my pretties!" He yelled. "you'll all be dead soon!"

Bookitty trips on a pizza box. Saul runs back toward her. "Are you alright?" He yelled.

"Go on without me!" She yells back. Saul runs to her aid, and kneels down, trying to help her up. It is only when he feels the knife in his torso that he realizes his mistake.

"Sorry bud." Says Bookitty. "But there's only room for one italian resturaunt on this street"

House and T S O join her, and the three of them watch their last victim die slowly. "Better get back to the joint" says T S O. "We open in half an hour".
